title: Vulnerability Report - sweet32 UPchieve

profile.name: UPchieve
profile.about: An edtech nonprofit democratizing access to academic support in the U.S.

vulnerability_information:
Hello Team.

I run the nmap with ssl-enum script to look for new Vulnerability that is known as "SWEET32"

Detail about sweet32 vuln:~

Cryptographic protocols like TLS, SSH, IPsec, and OpenVPN commonly use block cipher algorithms, such as AES, Triple-DES, and Blowfish, to encrypt data between clients and servers. To use such algorithms, the data is broken into fixed-length chunks, called blocks, and each block is encrypted separately according to a mode of operation. Older block ciphers, such as Triple-DES and Blowfish use a block size of 64 bits, whereas AES uses a block size of 128 bits.

note: this vulnerability and exploitation has been demo'ed at defcon

ref site: https://sweet32.info/

Here is another article on sweet32 https://bobcares.com/blog/how-to-fix-sweet32-birthday-attacks-vulnerability-cve-2016-2183/

Steps:

run nmap 2. type nmap --script ssl-enum-ciphers hackers.upchieve.org 3. now hit enter and let it do its work and after it done you will find that https:443 is vulnerable to sweet32. TLSv1.0 is vulnerable. Thanks.

POC :

Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2021-07-21 12:05 India Standard Time

## Impact

activities.message:
Hi @newpapa,

First of all hackers.upchieve.org uses cloudflare as CDN and you have scanned the IP `172.67.75.86` with nmap which belongs to cloudflare and based on your initial description, there do not appear to be any security implications as a direct result of this behavior. If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning. Including a working proof-of-concept can be incredibly helpful in our assessment of these claims till then the report is closed as informative.

For reference read: https://www.securityweek.com/i-got-99-problems-sweet32-isnt-one

Best regards,
@dexter0us

Hi @dexter0us ,

Thanks again for the update.

I agree your above statement .

Can you please üôè close this report as RESOLVED instead of Informative as any how this is valid security issue .

I will be very thankful ‚ò∫Ô∏èto you for the same.

@newpapa
Per our program policy, as an open organization we fully disclose all resolved, informative, and not applicable issues, in the interest of openness and transparency for our users.
